DESCRIPTION.value: Enterprise reference model for travel and cruise integration, emphasizing reservation, sales channels, partner interfaces, and the integration layer used to reduce point-to-point connections.

Disclaimer.value: AI-generated reference model. Validate against organization policies, vendor capabilities, and regulatory requirements before use.

Engagement Focus.value: Integration layer definition, partner-facing interface scope, interface catalogue/backlog, and early ADRs/NFRs for travel reservation and sales channels.

systems.Description: System of record for bookings, pricing commitments, availability, and passenger itineraries.
systems.Key Capabilities: Booking lifecycle; Itinerary management; Fare rules; Inventory control; PNR management
systems.Issues/Challenges: Legacy integrations and limited real-time partner visibility
systems.Future Improvements/Plans: Expose canonical APIs and event streams for booking lifecycle

systems.Description: Manages seat/cabin capacity, allotments, and inventory constraints across sailings and routes.
systems.Key Capabilities: Inventory pools; Allotments; Capacity controls; Release rules
systems.Issues/Challenges: Complex channel allocations and frequent inventory updates
systems.Future Improvements/Plans: Move to near real-time inventory events

systems.Description: Defines fares, promotions, packages, and yield rules.
systems.Key Capabilities: Dynamic pricing; Promotions; Package rules; Yield controls
systems.Future Improvements/Plans: Centralized pricing API and cache strategy

systems.Description: Orchestrates availability, pricing, and booking distribution to channels.
systems.Key Capabilities: Channel routing; Content syndication; Rate and availability distribution
systems.Issues/Challenges: Point-to-point channel adapters and inconsistent SLAs
systems.Future Improvements/Plans: Standardize partner adapters via integration layer

systems.Description: Customer-facing direct sales channels.
Portal for travel agents and corporate partners.
systems.Key Capabilities: Partner search; Booking; Amendments; Commission visibility
systems.Future Improvements/Plans: Partner interface scope pack and versioning

systems.Description: External distribution partners consuming inventory and booking APIs.
systems.Considerations: Requires clear contract versioning and SLAs to reduce partner churn

systems.Description: Global distribution systems for travel inventory and bookings.
systems.Considerations: Often requires legacy protocols and scheduled windows

systems.Description: Assisted booking and servicing via agents.
Payment authorization, settlement, refunds, and fraud checks.
systems.Key Capabilities: Payment capture; Refunds; Tokenization; Fraud screening
systems.Considerations: Requires strong idempotency and audit trails

systems.Description: Customer profiles, loyalty status, and engagement history.
systems.Key Capabilities: Customer profiles; Loyalty tiers; Campaign triggers
systems.Considerations: Consent and privacy enforcement for marketing communications

systems.Description: Operational systems for embarkation, onboard services, and disruption handling.
systems.Key Capabilities: Manifest management; Service delivery; Disruption workflows
systems.Considerations: Requires near real-time access to booking changes

systems.Description: Financial accounting, reconciliation, and revenue recognition.
Authentication, authorization, and partner access control.
systems.Key Capabilities: SSO; Partner access; API auth; MFA
systems.Considerations: Partner access must be isolated by contract and role

systems.Description: Monitoring, logging, tracing, and incident response for integrations.
systems.Considerations: Define end-to-end trace IDs for partner transactions

systems.Description: Enterprise data lake/warehouse for analytics and reporting.
API management, event bus, mediation, and partner adapters.
systems.Key Capabilities: API gateway; Event bus; Orchestration; Transformation; Partner adapters
systems.Future Improvements/Plans: Standardized API contracts and event schema governance
systems.Considerations: Acts as design authority for integration standards and ADRs

systems.Description: Email/SMS/push notifications for booking updates and disruptions.
End customers searching, booking, and servicing travel.
Third-party agents and agency staff selling travel products.
Operational users managing embarkation, onboard services, and disruptions.
Third parties integrating via partner APIs and events.

interactions.Description: Customer searches itineraries, prices, and initiates bookings.
Agents search and book on behalf of customers.
Direct channels call integration layer for search, price, and booking.
B2B portal consumes standardized partner APIs via integration layer.
Partners integrate via API gateway and event subscriptions.
interactions.Security Measures: mTLS; IP allow lists; audit logging
interactions.Considerations: Provide scope pack and onboarding checklist

interactions.Description: Create/modify/cancel bookings and retrieve booking state.
interactions.Considerations: Idempotency keys required for booking commands

interactions.Description: Real-time inventory checks and allotment validation.
interactions.Considerations: Fail-open vs fail-closed rules must be defined

interactions.Description: Retrieve prices, promotions, and package eligibility.
Booking created, amended, cancelled, ticketed, or departed.
interactions.Considerations: Event schema versioning and consumer idempotency

interactions.Description: Publish availability and pricing to channel manager.
interactions.Considerations: Throttling and back-pressure to avoid partner overload

interactions.Description: Distribute rates, inventory, and booking updates to OTAs.
Publish inventory to GDS and receive booking transactions.
interactions.Considerations: Legacy protocol adapters and scheduled cutovers

interactions.Description: Authorize and capture customer payments.
interactions.Considerations: Retry policy and idempotency for payment commands

interactions.Description: Payment success, failure, refunds, chargebacks.
Sync customer profile and loyalty changes.
Manifest updates and operational changes.
Operations staff manage embarkation and onboard changes.
Booking and payment events sent to finance for revenue recognition.
Operational and commercial data streams to analytics.
interactions.Considerations: Schema registry and data quality checks

interactions.Description: Send confirmations, reminders, and disruption notices.
Token validation and partner access checks.
Metrics, traces, and logs for integration flows.
